concept.definition:
[PR] Clinical exam
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI NM.

[PR] Ductogram
A medical imaging used to view breast ducts. It can aid in diagnosing the cause of an abnormal nipple discharge and is valuable in diagnosing intraductal papillomas and other conditions. 
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI NM.

[PR] Mammogram
An X-Ray picture of the breast. It's used to look for early signs of breast cancer. 
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI NM.

[PR] MRI
Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) is a test that uses powerful magnets, radio waves, and a computer to make detailed pictures inside your body. It helps a doctor to diagnose a disease or injury. 
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI NM.

[PR] Outside exam
Valid for the following modalities: MG.

[PR] Scintimammography
This is a type of breast imaging that is used to detect cancer cells in the breasts of some women who have had abnormal mammograms. 
Valid for the following modalities: NM.

[PR] Ultrasound
Uses soundwaves to develop ultrasound images. This information is relayed in real time to produce images on a computer screen. This can help diagnose and treat disease or conditions. 
Valid for the following modalities: MG US MRI NM.
